ext_descriptions.ext_description: An evaluation_result_enumlists the possible values of the evaluation result.
specifies that evaluation has failed;
specifies that evaluation has passed;
specifies that evaluation result is undefined.
An evaluation_status_enumlists the types of the evaluation.
specifies that evaluation is invalid;
specifies that evaluation is not evaluatable;
specifies that evaluation has to be performed
specifies that evaluation is valid;
A transition_code_enum is an enumeration of the types of continuity that can exist between adjacent curve segments when defining composite geometry.
at the point of contact the segments share a common tangent;
at the point of contact the segments share a common tangent and have the same radius of curvature.
there is simple contact continuity between adjacent segments;
the segments do not join;

An Activity is an identification of the occurrence of an action that has taken place, is taking place, or is expected to take place in the future. The procedure executed during that Activity is identified with the that is referred to by the chosen_method attribute. Change, distilling, design, a process to drill a hole, and a task such as training someone, are examples of activities. The items that are affected by an Activity, for example as input or output, may be identified within an instance of .
the identifier for the Activity.

ext_description.p: the activity_type specifies the purpose of the Activity.
The following values shall be used for activity_type:

ul.li: 'amendment': An Activity to add information to product data;
'analysis': An Activity to determine the behaviour of an element under certain physical circumstances;
'cancellation': An Activity to delete an element from the bill of material or to cancel the whole bill of material;
'delivery change': An Activity to change the delivery schedule of an element;
'design change': An Activity to change the design of an item or an assembly; this might include changes to the geometry or to properties of the object;
'design': An Activity concerning the development of a design of an item;
'mock-up creation': An Activity to create an experimental model or replica of an item;
'prototype building': An Activity to manufacture a preliminary version of an item;
'rectification': An Activity to correct the data, documentation or structure associated with an item;
'restructuring': An Activity to create a new structure or position within a bill of material without changing the data associated with the items in the bill of material;
'spare part creation': An Activity to design a spare part or to classify an item as a spare part;
'stop notice': An Activity to stop the manufacturing process of an item;
'testing': An Activity to test an item;
'work definition': An Activity to manage several sub-activities related to this Activity by an with a of value 'decomposition'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the actual_end_date specifies the date when the Activity actually finished. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the actual_start_date specifies the date when the Activity actually started. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the textual definition of the attribute. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Activity_method that specifies the procedure selected to carry out the Activity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the concerned_organizations specifies the set of objects that are affected by the result of the Activity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Activity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the planned_end_date specifies the date when the Activity is or was supposed to be finished. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the planned_start_date specifies the date when the Activity is or was supposed to be started. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the requestor specifies the or that requested the Activity and the date the request was submitted. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the resolved_requests specifie the set of objects that are resolved by the Activity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the status specifies the level of completion of the Activity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: The value 'open' is an example for status.
ext_description.note: The values and sequence of status are company specific.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the supplying_organizations specifie the set of objects that carry out the work. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the textual definition of the attribute.

An Activity_assignment is a an association of an with product or activity data. It characterizes the role of the concepts represented with these data with respect to the activity. This entity should not be used to represent the association of an activity with the organizations that are responsible for its execution or its management. That kind of information can be represented with instances of .

ext_description.p: the text that specifies the purpose of the association of the Activity_assignment with product or activity data. Where applicable, the following values shall be used for role:

ul.li: 'input': the concepts represented by the items are inputs of the ,
'output': the concepts represented by the items result from the ,
'constraint': the concepts represented by the items influence the execution of the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the set of that are associated with the assigned_activity.
the text that specifies the purpose of the association of the Activity_assignment with product or activity data.

An Activity_method is a way to carry out an . There may be more than one method for producing a required result. This definition may be used to characterize a way to resolve a request for action. The concept of action request is dealt with in module Work request.
the text that describes the results of application of this method. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Activity_method. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the words by which the Activity_method is known.
the text that provides an informal description of the reason for the Activity_method.
An Activity_method_relationship is a relationship between two instances of .
the text that provides further information about the Activity_method_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the other instance of that is part of the relationship.
the first instance of that is part of the relationship.
the textual definition of the attribute.

An Activity_method_work_request_association is an association between an and a . The associated serves as a recommended or non-recommended method to resolve the tasks specified in the . The association_type attribute characterizes the meaning of that association and the meaning of the with respect to the .
the associated_activity_method identifies the that is recommended or that shall not be chosen.
the associated_work_request identifies the that the recommended or non-recommended method applies to.

ext_description.p: the association_type specifies whether the specified may be used or not. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'non recommended method': The specified shall not be used in order to accomplish the specified ,
'recommended method': The specified may be used in order to accomplish the specified .

ext_description.p: An Activity_relationship is a relationship between two objects.
ext_description.example: The activity required to complete a work order, may be decomposed into a series of activities. Their corresponding instances would be related using instances of the Activity_relationship entity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the text that provides further information about the Activity_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the second instance of that is part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The related usually identifies the , which is based on the definition of the relating.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the second instance of that is part of the relationship.
ext_description.note: The relating usually identifies the , which is based on the definition of the related, for example, derived from or dependent on.
The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the relation_type specifies the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'alternative': The application object defines a relationship where the related may be used alternatively instead of the relating ;
'decomposition': The application object defines a relationship where the related is one of potentially more sub-activities into which the relating is broken down;

'derivation': The application object defines a relationship where the related is derived from the relating ;
An that is controlled by a with 'manufacturing release' may be derived from (is based on) another controlled by another with 'design release'..
'exclusiveness': The application object defines a relationship where the relating and the related shall not have any overlap in time of execution;
'precedence': The application object defines a relationship where the related has higher priority than the relating ;
'sequence': The application object defines a relationship where the relating shall be completed before the related starts;

'simultaneity': The application object defines a relationship that establishes that both the relating and related are considered as occurring during the same time period or shall be performed together in order to ensure consistency and enhance efficiency.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Address is the information necessary for communicating, using one or more communication methods.
the name of a country. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the electronic address at which electronic mail may be received. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the number at which facsimiles may be received. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
an organization-defined address for internal mail delivery. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the words by which the Address is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: "White House", "Buckingham Palace","Kremlin".

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the number of a postal box. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the code that is used by the country's postal service. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the name of a region. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: The counties of Great Britain and the states of the United States of America are examples of regions.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the name of a street. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the number of a location on a street. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the number at which telephone calls may be received. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the number at which telex messages may be received. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the name of a town. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the text that specifies the uniform resource locator associated with the address. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: The format of uniform resource locators is defined in IETF RFC 1738 [31].
ext_description.example: URLs are used to identify world wide web sites, file transfer protocol (FTP) servers, etc.

ext_description.p: An Alias_identification is a mechanism to associate an object with an additional identifier that is used to identify the object of interest in a different context, either in another , or in some other context. The scope of the Alias_identification shall be specified either by the attribute scope or by the attribute description.
ext_description.note: Alias_identification only applies to concepts that possess an attribute that conveys an identifier or a name.
ext_description.example: A document (e.g., a book) may have a unique document id (ISBN) and an Alias_identification as inventory number in the context of the inventory of a company.

ext_description.p: the text that provides further information about the Alias_identification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: The description may be, e.g., 'inventory number'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identifier for the Alias_identification.

ext_description.p: the object that has an Alias_identification.
ext_description.note: If applied to a , it is not the id but the name attribute that has this alias.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the in which the Alias_identification is valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the version of the object as known in the context of the Alias_identification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: A version_id may be applied even if the object of interest does not have versions.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Alternate_part_relationship is an association between two instances of . It specifies that any version of the alternate part, may be used in place of any version of the base part, regardless of its usages and of its versions. The relationship established by the Alternate_part_relationship is not symmetric: if B is an alternate part for A, A is not implied to be an alternate part for B. If a part is an alternate for another part, it is understood that there is no interest in keeping track of which part, the base or any alternates specified, is used as a particular instance of the base part within a part structure An organization may track design changes for a base part, and establish effectivity conditions for the use of that base part in various assemblies to be manufactured. The use of an alternate part implies that an organization does not specify any particular version of the alternate part nor establish effectivities relating to it An Alternate_part_relationship may relate parts of any kind, provided both related instances of Part identify parts of the same part category. An Alternate_part_relationship for which the base part is an assembly involves that the entire part structure of the alternate part may be used in place of the base part and its part structure. This concept usually refers to form, fit, function, and quality. Additional properties such as performance, noise, endurance, or reliability may also be considered as a prerequisite for the replacement Two bolts of the same size are parts. One bolt has a square head and the other has a hexagonal head. The two bolts are considered equivalent with respect to form, fit, and function: they both have sufficiently close physical shape, they take up the same space when used, and they both serve to fasten two things together. Thus, one of these two bolts could be considered to be an alternate part for the other bolt.
specifies the that may be used in place of the base .
specifies the for which another may be used as a replacement.
the text that provides further information about the Alternate_part_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies the word or group of words describing the requirements that are covered by both the base and the alternate and therefore are the basis for the statement regarding the capability of of replacing the base part by the alternate part. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: Additional properties such as performance, noise, endurance, or reliability may also be considered as a prerequisite for the replacement in addition to form, fit, function, and quality.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the words by which the Alternative_solution is known.

An Application_context is a the grouping of an application domain and a life cycle stage. It identifies a universe of discourse suitable for the description of parts. Requirements and vocabularies vary among the industrial activity fields. This entity intends to identify such domains.

ext_description.p: the identification of the applications for which an object may be relevant. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'assembly study': The object may be relevant for an assembly study;
'digital mock-up': The object may be relevant for digital mock-up;
'electrical design': The object may be relevant for the electrical design;
'mechanical design': The object may be relevant for the mechanical design;
'preliminary design': The object may be relevant for the preliminary design;
'process planning': The object may be relevant for the process planning.
'not specific': The object is considered as not specific of any application domain.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the text that provides further information about the Application_context. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the general stage in the product life cycle to which the concerned items belong. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'design': The concerned item belongs to the design phase of the life cycle;
'manufacturing': The concerned item belongs to the manufacturing phase of the life cycle;
'recycling': The concerned item belongs to the recycling phase of the life cycle.
'not specific': The object is considered as not specific of any life cycle stage.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Approval is a judgement and formal confirmation of the quality of those product or activity data that are subject of the Approval. An Approval represents a statement made by technical personnel or management personnel whether certain requirements are met. The absence of approval information does not imply any approval status by default.

ext_description.p: the point in time when the Approval actually became valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: In cases, where more than one person or organization has to sign off on the Approval, usually the last sign-off date corresponds to the date specified as the actual date.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the personnel responsible for the Approval and the dates of the Approval. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the point in time when the Approval is or was supposed to be performed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the text that completes the information provided within the status attribute, specifying the reason or goal of the Approval.
ext_description.example: 'released for production' or 'preliminary design completed' are approval purposes.

example.p: Where applicable, the following values may be used:

ul.li: 'disposition': The referenced object is approved for series production;
'planning': The referenced object is technically complete and has reached a status sufficiently stable so that other designs may be based on it.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the set of
objects for which the Approval is valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: a user interpretable designation of the level of acceptance of the object that the Approval is assigned to, in the context of the specified purpose.
ext_description.note: The approval purposes are defined within a given life cycle stage view and are typically dependent upon the approval cycles within an individual business process. For each defined purpose, generally there is a defined sequence of values for the status, usually leading towards the status 'approved' indicating achievement of the particular purpose.

ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the text that specifies the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'decomposition': The related is one of the components into which the relating is broken down with no implication of 'sequence' or 'dependency';

'dependency': The issuing of the related
is dependent on the issuing of the relating ; The value 'dependency' does not imply the semantics of the values 'decomposition' or 'sequence'. The of an assembly may be dependent on the of all of the constituents of the assembly. In two parallel sequences of approvals for two assemblies a certain approval of one assembly may be dependent on a certain approval of the second assembly.
'precedence': The related has higher priority than the relating ;
'sequence': The relating shall be completed before the related is given.

ext_description.p: Informal proposition: The graph of instances of , related by instances of Approval_relationship, shall be acyclic.

ext_description.p: An Axis1_placement is the direction and location in three-dimensional space of a single axis. An Axis1_placement is defined in terms of a locating point (inherited from the placement supertype) and an axis direction; this is either the direction of axis or defaults to (0.0,0.0,1.0). The actual direction for the axis placement is given by the derived attribute z. the representation of three orthogonal axes defined in a three-dimensional reference coordinate system, which intersects at a unique point. This point defines the origin of the .
An Axis1_placement is a type of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the direction of the local Z axis. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Axis2_placement_2d is the location and orientation in two-dimensional space of two mutually perpendicular axes. An Axis2_placement_2d is defined in terms of a point, (inherited from the placement supertype), and an axis. It can be used to locate and orientate an object in two-dimensional space and to define a placement coordinate system. The entity includes a point which forms the origin of the placement coordinate system. A direction vector is required to complete the definition of the placement coordinate system. The ref_directiondefines the placement X axis direction; the placement Y axis direction is derived from this.
A Axis2_placement_2d is a type of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the direction used to determine the direction of the local X axis. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If ref_direction is omitted, this direction is taken from the geometric coordinate system.

ext_description.p: An Axis2_placement_3d is is the location and orientation in three-dimensional space of two mutually perpendicular axes. An Axis2_placement_3d is defined in terms of a point, (inherited from the placement supertype), and two (ideally orthogonal) axes. It can be used to locate and orientate a non axis-symmetric object in space and to define a placement coordinate system. The entity includes a point which forms the origin of the placement coordinate system. Two direction vectors are required to complete the definition of the placement coordinate system. The axis is the placement Z axis direction and the ref_directionis an approximation to the placement X axis direction.
ext_description.note: Let z be the placement Z axis direction and a be the approximate placement X axis direction. There are two methods, mathematically identical but numerically different, for calculating the placement X and Y axis direc-tions. The vector a is projected onto the plane defined by the origin point P and the vector z to give the placement X axis direction as x = (a -(a.z)z). The placement Y axis direction is then given by y = (z x x). The placement Y axis direction is calculated as y = (z x a) and then the placement X axis direction is given by x = (y x z). The first method is likely to be the more numerically stable of the two, and is used here.
ext_description.p: An Axis2_placement_3d is a type of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Cartesian_coordinate_space is a coordinate space in which geometric and annotation elements may be defined. It is either two-dimensional or three-dimensional. An origin for coordinate values is implicitly defined. The units applicable to the coordinate values of elements defined in the Cartesian_coordinate_space are specified.
ext_description.note: Cartesian Transformation objects are used to specify the relationships between coordinate spaces.
ext_description.p: Each Cartesian_coordinate_space is a or a .

the various units in which any values are expressed. In the case where geometric elements are defined in the Cartesian_coordinate_space, there shall be at least two units specified, the length unit and the plane angle unit. The same length unit is applied to each coordinate direction. Only one unit of a kind shall be specified. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The unit_of_values need not be specified only if the Cartesian_coordinate_space belongs to an .
ext_description.note:
If elements with different units are required, they have to be separated into different models with their own
Cartesian_coordinate_space.
ext_description.p: A length measure unit measured in inches and an angle measure unit measured in degrees are examples for two members of the attribute unit_of_values assigned to the same Cartesian_coordinate_space. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Cartesian_coordinate_space_2d two-dimensional coordinate space. Any two-dimensional geometric and annotation element shall be defined in a Cartesian_coordinate_space_2d.
A Cartesian_coordinate_space_2d is a type of

A Cartesian_coordinate_space_3d is a three-dimensional coordinate space. Any three-dimensional geometric data shall be defined in a Cartesian_coordinate_space_3d. A Cartesian_coordinate_space_3d is a type of .
A Cartesian_coordinate_space_3d is a type of

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the words by which the Cartesian_point is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Centre_of_mass is a type of
that is the centre of the mass of a body. The relative position of the Centre_of_mass within the body is an invariant datum relative to rotation and translation. The Centre_of_mass is a characteristic of a part, not its shape.
ext_description.note: If a shape representation is present, the Centre_of_mass is usually derivable from the shape representation. However, as a characteristic of a part, it may be pre-defined in order to reflect a requirement.

In order to convey the information about the actual centre of mass of a geometric model, the use of
with value 'centroid' for its attribute is appropriate.

A Class is a classification of an object which characterizes all objects of the same kind; such a classification is independent from the application of the classified object. A fastener with subclasses, such as fastener with 2 or 3 fixture holes, a bracket with subclasses, e.g., with 90 or 100 degrees bending angle, or screws with subclasses such as metal screws or machine screws are examples for Class.
For facilitating an effective part retrieval for slotted screws, several Class objects may be defined to classify screws:
A Class *1 with description 'slotted screws' and three subclasses with the descriptions *2: 'slotted cheese head screws - product grade A', *3: 'slotted pan head screws - product grade A', and *4: 'slotted countersunk flat head screws - product grade A'.
Each of the Class objects is based on a Class that further defines where the definition of the Class comes from. For Class *1 this is a company internal Class_system for 'screw classes'. For the other Class objects these are ISO standardized Class_system objects, namely for *2 'ISO 1207', for *3 'ISO 1580', and for *4 'ISO 2010'.
The Class objects may be defined as well in an ISO 13584 compliant library (PLIB). In this case, Class *1 references as a classification source an External_library_reference that has an id corresponding to the class_BSU, i. e. a worldwide unique identification of that class as defined according to ISO 13584-42. In another case, the source of a Class may only be available as a document in paper form. In this case, Class *4 references a Physical_document_definition with document id 'DIN EN ISO 2010' and description 'slotted countersunk flat head screws - product grade A'.
The Class objects may be characterized further by Class_attribute objects. According to ISO 1207, the Class *2 has the attributes *11 with id 'd' and description 'thread', *12 with id 'l' and description 'nominal length', *13 with id 'mechanical properties' and description 'property class', etc. The possible values 'M1.6', 'M2', ..., 'M10' for Class_attribute *11 may be defined as Property objects in a set of the attribute allowed_values. The according specification is given as 'value_name' of the AO Property_value referenced by 'specified_value'. The Property refer as their definition to a Property_definition with the 'property_type' 'nominal metric thread diameter'.
To identify the designation 'Cheese head screw ISO 1207 - M5 x 20 x 4.8', a subclass of Class *2 is defined with the same description and classification source and the description 'slotted cheese head screws ISO 1207 -M5 x 20 x 4.8' but with the values for Class_attribute corresponding to *11 restricted to 'M5' only, i.e., to get just the M5 screws, corresponding to *12 restricted to value '20' only, and corresponding to *13 restricted to value '4.8' only (for steel according to ISO 898-1 [7]).

ext_description.p: A Class_category_association is an association of a with a . Additionally, this assignment specifies if the usage of one or more objects belonging to this , is mandatory or optional for all products of that .

ext_description.p: specifies whether the objects referring to the associated have to be used or may be used (optional) for products within the referenced . A value of 'true' indicates that the usage is mandatory.
ext_description.example: The specification category 'radio' may be associated 'optional' to the product class of a car; the specification category 'engine' is an example for a 'mandatory' association.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Class_condition_association is an association of a with a . The meaning of this association is specified further by the attribute condition_type.

ext_description.p: specifies the meaning of the association. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li:
'design case': The specifies a condition when a given object has to be designed and verified. This value of the condition_type is for information only and shall not be interpreted when querying design cases or usage cases. For such a query, the value of the attribute configuration_type of shall be evaluated;
This value may be used to precise when a given or a given has to be studied by the design department so that it provides solutions appropriate for the case specified by the attributes associated_condition and associated_product_class.

'identification': The specifies a condition that enables to distinguish the associated from other objects. This value is not applicable for a top level node in a hierarchy of objects. This identification is part of the identification of all sub classes of this ;

'part usage': The specifies a condition for the usage of the components of an , the usage of an or for the application of a or a in the products of the associated_product_class. In this case, the Class_condition_association shall be referenced by at least one object;

'validity': The specifies a condition that is used to verify a for the associated_product_class. That means that the evaluates to 'true' if the set of objects is valid; otherwise it evaluates to 'false' with the meaning that the specified object is invalid for the . The associated_condition is valid for all products belonging to the associated_product_class if condition_type is 'identification' or 'validity'.

'power brake' is a 'replaceable standard' for product class 'Golf'; it can be replaced by 'ABS', which is another specification of the same specification category 'brake system'.

ext_description.p: A Configuration is a the association of a Class_condition_association or a Class_specification_association object with a design or with a process in order to define a valid usage of it in the context of a certain Product_class
ext_description.note: The validity of the association may be limited by a time period through assigning an Effectivity object to it.
The semantics of the kind of association is defined by the attributes 'configuration_type' and 'inher-itance_type'.

ext_description.p: the valid usage of a Configuration object that is applied to the application object as configured_element. The following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'design': The object referenced as 'configured_element' has to be designed and verified before it can actually be used in a given context. This context is specified by the Class_condition_association and Class_specification_association objects referenced as the 'is_solution_for'. This type of Configuration is applicable for Alternative_solution, Breakdown_element, Process_plan, or Process_operation_occurrence objects;

'usage': The object referenced as the 'configured_element' is controlled by a Configuration. The Class_condition_association and Class_specification_association objects specify the usage cases and are referenced as the 'is_solution_for'.

ext_description.p: This type of Configuration is applicable for Alternative_solution, Part_instance, Process_plan, Process_operation_occurrence, or Physical_breakdonwn_element objects.
ext_description.example: The presence of an optional third rear axle of a truck is controlled by specifications on the level of Physical_breakdown_element.
A 'sun-roof' has to be provided, i.e., designed for a class of vehicles that has an optional 'sun-roof' as part of its specification.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the element that is controlled for its valid usage by the Configuration.

ext_description.p: specifies whether or not an inheritance scheme for the configuration information in a hierarchical structure is applied to the application object referenced as the configured_element. The levels within such a hierarchy are defined through Realization_or_occur¬rence_¬relationship objects or the attribute 'based_on' of Alternative_solution. The following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'exception': No inheritance scheme is applicable and all required configuration information must be attached locally at the application object. The value indicates that the configuration information may be inconsistent to the structural levels above it or that it is, on purpose, contradictory to it. Such a condition implies that an inheritance scheme shall not continue beyond this point in the product structure tree

ext_description.example: A situation where the inheritance_type 'exception' is applicable is a technical solution released for one particular customer without support in higher structure levels.

ul.li: 'inherited': A scheme for inheritance of configuration information applies. The complete configuration information shall be collected from the different levels in the structure by evaluation of results. The results shall be evaluated using the logical AND to combine configuration information starting at the referenced configured_element and using the logical OR to combine alternatives. In addition, this evaluation shall consider related effectivity information. 'inherited' only applies for objects for which the same value of 'configuration_type' is defined;

ext_description.example: The following figure shows how inheritance is applied along the tree of a product structure. The complete configuration information of a Part_instance can be obtained by adding any such information to Alternative_solution objects which are linked through Realiza-tion_or_occur¬rence_¬relationship objects and 'based_on' attributes respectively. Whenever more than one higher level instance is present, the current information available is branched in as many branches as instances are present. For example, the total configuration information for the Part_instance given in the figure above could be expressed as follows: (C0.0 AND C1.0 AND C2.0) OR (C0.0 AND C1.1 AND C2.1) OR (C0.0 AND C1.1 AND C2.2).

ul.li: 'local': No inheritance scheme is applicable and all required configuration information must be attached locally at the application object. Nevertheless, any potentially inherited configuration information of a higher level shall be consistent, i.e., it shall be a subset of the locally defined configuration information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the characteristic or combination of characteristics for which the object referenced as the configured_element provides a solution or which is needed to control a process operation. These characteristics are defined by a Class_specification_association and combinations of characteristics are defined by a Class_condition_association where the attribute 'condition type' is 'part usage'.

ext_description.p: A Date_and_person_assignment is a an object that associates a Date_and_person_organization with product data. This assignment provides additional information for the associated object. The provision of such data through this assignment has an organizational character whereas some objects require the same kind of data mandatorily in order to be semantically complete. This assignment shall not be used to associate the corresponding organizational data with an object whose attributes are referencing the organizational data directly.
ext_description.example: An example for the requirement stated is that there shall not exist a Date_and_person_assignment with a role of 'requestor' that refers to a Work_request, since this object refers directly to Date_and_person_organization in that role.
ext_description.note: In the context of the object Date_and_person_assignment, the expression 'referenced object' means 'a concept that is conveyed within one of the instances referred to by the attribute 'is_applied_to' and not one of the instances referred to by this attribute.
ext_description.example: If applied to an instance of Item with role 'creation', the Date_and_person_assignment specifies the creation date of the part, tool, or raw material as a new object in the activity domain of the organization, and not the creation date of the instance of Item in the product management system of the organization.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the Date_and_person_organization.

the text that provides further information about the Date_and_person_assignment.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the set of objects with which the Date_and_person_assignment is associated.

ext_description.p: specifies the relationship between the date or time and the person or organization in the Date_and_person_assignment. Where applicable the following values shall be use:

ul.li: 'creation': The assignment specifies that the referenced object has been created by the given person or organization at the given date and time;
'update': The assignment specifies that the referenced object has been altered by the given person or organization at the given date and time.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Date_and_person_organization is a Person_in_organization or an Organization associated with a Date_time or an Event_reference.
specifies the date and an optional time of day component of a Date_and_person_organization, or alternatively a discrete point in time as an Event_reference.
specifies the Organization or the Person_in_organization that is part of the Date_and_person_organization.

ext_description.p: A Date_or_date_time_assignment is an association of point in time specified as a Date_time or an Event_reference with product data. This assignment provides additional information for the associated object. The provision of such data through this assignment has an organizational character whereas some objects require the same kind of data mandatorily in order to be semantically complete. This assignment shall not be used to associate the corresponding organizational data with an object whose attributes are referencing the organizational data directly.
ext_description.example: An example for the requirement stated is that there shall not exist a Date_or_date_time_assignment with a role of 'actual start date' that refers to an Activity, since this object refers directly to Date_time in that role.
ext_description.note: In the context of the object Date_or_date_time_assignment, the expression 'referenced object' means 'a concept that is conveyed within one of the instances referred to by the attribute 'is_applied_to' and not one of the instances referred to by this attribute.
ext_description.example: If applied to an instance of Part with role 'creation', the Date_or_date_time_assignment specifies the creation date of the part, tool, or raw material as a new object in the activity domain, and not the creation date of the instance of Part in a product management system.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the Date_time, or alternatively a discrete point in time as an Event_reference that is associated with the product data.

the text that provides further information about the Date_or_date_time_assignment.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies the action associated with the Date_or_date_time_assignment. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'classification date': The assignment specifies that the specified object is classified at the given date and time. This value shall only be used, if the Date_or_date_time_assignment refers to instances of Classification_association as 'is_applied_to';
'creation': The assignment specifies that the referenced object was created at the given date and time;

'installation': The assignment specifies that the referenced object was mounted in a product at the given date and time;
This role is applicable, e.g., when referring to a Physical_instance.

'production': The assignment specifies that the referenced object was produced at the given date and time;
This role is applicable, e.g., when referring to a Physical_instance.

'registration': The assignment specifies that the referenced object was determined at the given date and time;
This role is applicable, e.g., when referring to a Property.
'update': The assignment specifies that the referenced object was altered at the given date and time.

ext_description.p: A Dated_effectivity is a type of for which the domain of applicability is defined as an interval of time bounded by dates or events. The interval may be open-ended.
Depending on whether the end_bound attribute is specified, the actual domain of time defined by a Dated_effectivity is:

ul.li: either, the time interval between the start and end date or event;
or, the open time interval that starts at the start date or event.

ext_description.p: If the end_bound is an event that actually identifies a point in time that comes before the start_bound, then the actual domain of effectivity is empty.
ext_description.example: objects may be used to bound a Dated_effectivity period, which may be especially useful at a planning stage.

ext_description.p: the date or event that defines the upper bound of the interval of applicability. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the value for this attribute is not specified, the interval of applicability has no upper limit.

ext_description.p: A Design_constraint is a a definition of a version of requirement that impacts the design of some physical or functional elements.
ext_description.note: In the present context, design of a functional or physical element means design of parts that realize or fulfills the functional or organic requirement.
ext_description.example: Ergonomic information like 'hip point' or 'forward driver vision' as well as 'door opening control lines', 'shipping critical dimensions', or 'stone throw zone' are examples of design constraint.
The standard diameter of soft drink cans is a constraint for designing the hole of a cup holder in a car.

ext_description.p: A Direction defines a general direction vector in two or three dimensional space. The actual magni-tudes of the components have no effect upon the direction being defined, only the ratios x:y:z or x:y are significant.
ext_description.note: The components of this entity are not normalised. If a unit vector is required it should be normalised before use.

ext_description.p: is a list, the individual elements of this list are defined below.

ul.li: direction_ratios[1]: The component in the direction of the X axis.
direction_ratios[2]: The component in the direction of the Y axis.
direction_ratios[3]: The component in the direction of the Z axis; this value shall not be present in the case of a direction in two-dimensional coordinate space.

A Document_assignment is a mechanism to associate a document with the objects, where the assigned document provides information about the object it is associated to.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the Document_assignment. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'additional information': The assigned document provides information that is relevant for the associated object, but is not a description of the associated object itself;
'behavior': The assigned document specifies information about the behaviour of the associated object;
'description': The assigned document provides textual information for the associated object itself;
'informative': The assigned document may or may not be considered;
'mandatory': The associated object shall conform to the content of the assigned document;
'mathematical description': The assigned document specifies the associated object by providing the algorithmic specification of its behavior.

A Document_content_property specifies characteristics precising the content of a or of a . At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object. In the case where a Document_content_property is referred by a , the characteristics apply to all individual objects, whereas in the case where it is referred by a , the characteristics apply on an individual basis.

ext_description.p: the kind or kinds of geometry that an object contains. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: '3D wireframe model': The document contains a 3D shape model in wireframe representation;
'2D shape': The document contains a 2D shape model or contours only;
'surface model': The document contains a 3D shape model in surface representation;
'closed volume': The document contains a 3D shape model in closed body topological surface representation;
'solid model': The document contains a 3D shape model in advanced boundary representation;
'solid and surface model': The document contains a 3D shape model in surface and advanced boundary representation;
'assembly': The document contains an assembly structure with reference to the assembled components and their transformation matrices;

'assembly with mating elements': The document contains an assembly structure including the mating components only, such as screws or rivets, with exact positioning information. This assembly representation is intended to be overlayed with the assembly structure for the main components;
'2D drawing': The document contains a technical drawing without 3D shape representation;
'drawing derived from 3D data': The document contains a technical drawing that has been derived from a 3D shape model;
'drawing related to 3D data': The document contains a technical drawing that visualizes a 3D shape model and possibly establishes associative left to the 3D shape model.

ext_description.p: A Document_definition is one of potentially more alternative representations of a .
ext_description.note: A Document_version may have more than one representation.
ext_description.example: A version of a logical document, which contains a shape model, may be represented in the different native formats of two 3D CAD systems.

ext_description.note: Different common locations represent alternative representations of the same physical location.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Document_definition_relationship is a relationship between two objects.

the text that provides further information about the Document_definition_relationship.

The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'addition': The application object specifies that the related document provides supplementary or collateral information with regard to the information provided by the relating document;
'copy': The application object defines a relationship where the related is a copy of the relating ;

'decomposition': The application object defines a relationship where the related is one of potentially more sub documents of the relating ; The decomposition of a document into clauses is an example for the use of this value.

'peer': The application object specifies that the related document provides required information with regard to that provided by the relating document. The peer document is essential for a complete understanding;
'reference': The application object defines a relationship where the related document is referenced from the relating; A hyperlink is an example for a 'reference'.
'sequence': The application object defines a logical sequence where the related comes after the relating ; A sequence of clauses.
'substitution': The application object defines a relationship where the related replaces the relating ;
'translation': The Document_definition_relationship specifies that the related document is generated through a translation process from the relating document.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Document_format_property specifies characteristics of a or of a that specify the format of the object. At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object. In the case where a Document_format_property is referred by a the characteristics apply to all individual objects, whereas in the case it is referred by a the characteristics apply on an individual basis.
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Document_format_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Document_format_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Document_format_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the words by which the Document_format_property is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the dimensions of a physical presentation of the object the size_format is provided for. 'ISO A0' is an example for the size_format of a drawing that is stored digitally.
'0.2 x 0.4 x 0.4 meters' is an example for the size_format of a wooden model.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
A Document_location_identification is a type of
that specifies where a or a can be found in a digital or physical data storage system.

example.p: An HTML file that includes a picture may be represented as a Document_definition made of two components:

ul.li: the HTML file;
the binary file that contains the picture.

example.p: If these files were located within the same directory or relatively to the same directory, the source_id attribute would convey the directory name.

ul.li: 'URL' - for a web page;
'FTP' - for an FTP address;
'ISBN' - for physical documents.

ext_description.p: In the case where a Document_location_property is referred by a , the characteristics apply to all individual objects, whereas in the case it is referred by a , the characteristics apply on an individual basis.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Document_size_property specifies the size of a or of a object. At least one of the optional attributes shall be specified for each instance of this object. In the case where a Document_size_property is referred by a , the size information is the sum of the sizes of all individual objects that are collected by this object, whereas in the case it is referred by a , the size information is the one of the individual objects that is referenced.
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Document_size_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Document_size_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the that represents the size of a digitally stored document. The file_size shall only be applied in cases where the Document_size_property is referred by a or a .
'15021 Bytes' and 'less than 500 Bytes' are examples for a file_size.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Document_size_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the words by which the Document_size_property is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the number of pages of the application object the Document_size_property is referred by. The page_count shall only be used in cases where the Document_size_property is referred by a or a .
'42 pages' and 'more than 1 page' are examples of a page_count. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Document_type_property specifies the kind of a .
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Document_type_property. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Document_type_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the word or the group of words that describe the kind of data that are contained in a that refers to the Document_type_property. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'geometry': The document represents a shape model;
'NC data': The document represents numerical control data;
'FE data': The document represents finite element data;
'sample data': The document represents measured data;
'process plan': The document represents process planning data;
'check plan': The document represents quality control planning data;
'drawing': The document represents a technical drawing.

the identifier for the Document_type_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the words by which the Document_type_property is known.

the Classification_system the document_type_name is defined in. A Document_type_property may be used with 'specification type 1' and 'specification type 2' as values for the attribute 'document_type_name' due to a companywide definition. By inclusion of these types in a with name 'specification' and description 'specification of company XY' these types of documents are better classified and the meaning of 'specification type 1' and 'specification type 2' can be further detailed in an attached document to the or by a reference to a for document types with that organization.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Document_version is a release of a Document.

the text that provides further information about the Document_version.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Document_version.
the logical document the Document_version is a version of.
A Document_version_relationship is a relationship between two objects.

the text that provides further information about the Document_version_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the second of the two objects related by the Document_version_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the first of the two objects related by the Document_version_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'derivation': The business object defines a deriving relationship where the related Document_version is based on the relating Document_version which is an earlier version of the same or of a different Document;

'hierarchy': The business object defines a hierarchical relationship where the related Document_version is a sub version of the relating Document_version; 'Revision 1.1' and 'revision 1.2' are examples of sub-versions of 'version 1'.
'sequence': The business object defines a version sequence where the relating Document_version is the preceding version and the related Document_version is the following version.

'supplied document': The business object defines a relationship between two Document_version objects representing the same object in different organizational contexts. The different organizational contexts can be represented by different general organizational data associations with the related Document_version objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Duration is the definition of a period of time.
specifies the extent of the Duration.

ext_description.p:
A Duration_property_definition is a type of
that specifies a period of time during which a given object is used or will last.
ext_description.example: Duration_property_definition may be used to specify the duration of a .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Effectivity is an identification of the valid use of an aspect of product data tracked by date, event, serial number or lot size.
An instance of Effectivity may define a period or a part of ineffectivity, i.e., of invalid use, if it is referred to by an instance of with 'effectivity_indication' set to 'false'.
A 'start' value shall always be specified for a particular type of Effectivity, an 'end' value may be specified.
This application protocol does not allow to specify effectivity or ineffectivity intervals without start values.
If period or lot-size are not specified, the effectivity or ineffectivity is endless.
An Effectivity may 'inherit' its interval from another Effectivity through an with relation_type 'inheritance'. If a 'start' and no 'end' is specified, the period or lot-size is then added to 'start' in order to get the actual 'end' of the effectivity or ineffectivity.
If both 'start' and 'end' are specified, the period should not be specified because of redundancy. If specified, it shall be equal to the measure between the 'start' and the 'end' of the effectivity or ineffectivity.
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Effectivity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the set of objects in that the Effectivity is valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If concerned_organizations is an empty set, the Effectivity is globally applicable.
ext_description.example: The Effectivity of the same part may be different in the various production sites of a car manufacturer.
ext_description.note: As Effectivity is in most cases organization dependent, it is recommended always to populate the concerned_organizations attribute.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text that provides further information about the Effectivity.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the life cycle stage for which the Effectivity is valid. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Effectivity.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identification of a particular version of the Effectivity. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

An Effectivity_assignment associates an with the product or activity data whose effectivity is controlled by the associated . The association of an to product or activity data does not imply any statement concerning the effectivity outside of the specified interval. The same applies in the absence of any assigned effectivity, i.e. no statement concerning the effectivity is implied.
the instance of that is assigned.

specifies whether the assigned_effectivity defines a period of effectivity (value equal 'TRUE') or a period of ineffectivity (value equal 'FALSE') for the is_assigned_to. In the first case, use of is_assigned_to objects is or was valid during the considered period.
This does not imply that use of the is_assigned_to objects is mandatory.
In the second case, use of is_assigned_to objects is or was not valid during the considered period.
the objects whose are characterized by the assigned_effectivity.

ext_description.p: the text that specifies the purpose of the association of the with objects. For an that identifies a period of time, if applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'actual': The assigned_effectivity defines a period of time during which the associated objects are or were effective;
'planned': The assigned_effectivity defines a period of time during which the associated objects are or were expected to be effective;
'required': The assigned_effectivity defines a period of time during which the associated objects are or were required to be effective.

ext_description.p: An Effectivity_relationship is a relationship between two objects. The meaning of the relationship is represented by the relation_type attribute.
ext_description.note: Sometimes effectivity is not dependent on particular dates or serial numbers, but on the effectivity of other items. In this case end values are not instantiated, but are derived via an Effectivity_relationship to the reference .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text that provides further information about the Effectivity_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the second of the two objects related by the Effectivity_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the first of the two objects related by the Effectivity_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the text that specifies the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'constraint': The domain of the related shall be included in the domain of the relating .
'inheritance': The related shall not have an 'end' specified, but inherits the effectivity values from the relating .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Element_delivery is a

An Evaluated_characteristic is a set of properties resulting from an evaluation or intended evaluation of product data. The Evaluated_characteristic associates evaluation data with a Planned_characteristic for the purposes of traceability.
the Property values for an Evaluated_characteristic. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the instance of Activity that describes details of the evaluation procedure. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the result of the evaluation for the Evaluated_characteristic. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'fail': the evaluation has failed;
'pass': the evaluation has passed;
'undefined': the evaluation result is undefined.

ext_description.p: the value that describes the status of the evaluation. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'invalid': the evaluation is not valid;
'not_evaluatable': the evaluation is not conclusive;
'to_be_evaluated': the evaluation shall be performed;
‘valid’: the evaluation is valid.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the words by which the Evaluated_characteristic is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Planned_characteristic object that the evaluation data relate to.

ext_description.p: An Event is the fact of the existence of a state at some point in time.
ext_description.note: The event may have occurred or may be not yet started.
The point in time where an event will start or started, may not be known or specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Event.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies the kind of event.
ext_description.example: The event_type may be the 'start of production' of a Product_class specified as 'event_context' .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the amount of time before or after the defined event that shall be used to calculate the actual point in time. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Date_time when the event is or was planned to start. The value of the attribute need not be specified.
An Event_assignment is the assignment of an Event to product or activity data.
the product or activity data to which the Event is assigned. the Event to be assigned to product or activity data.

ext_description.p: An Event_relationship is a relationship which exists between two Events.
ext_description.example: An instance of this entity data type with relation_type 'sequence' may be used to specify that an event shall end before another event starts.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the text that provides further information about the Event_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the other related instance of Event is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.
one of the instances of Event that is a part of the relationship.

ext_description.p: the string that defines the kind of relationship that is specified. Where applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'actualization': The relationship specifies that the relating Event identifies a predicted or planned event and the related Event identifies the point in time when that event actually occurred. This relationship is valid if the actual_start_date attribute of the relating Event is not specified and the actual_start_date attribute of the related Event is specified, or, if both these attributes are specified and equal;
'exclusiveness': The relationship specifies that the relating and the related Event shall not have any overlap during their duration;
'sequence': The relationship specifies that the relating Event shall be completed before the related Event starts;

'simultaneity': The relationship specifies that that both the relating and related Event are considered as occurring during the same time period or shall be performed together in order to ensure consistency and enhance efficiency. The criteria for 'simultaneity' and in particular the allowed delay between two events declared simultaneous, are user-dependent.

An External_geometric_model is a type of
that contains geometry in a 3D context only.

the kind of accuracy that is applied. Where applicable the following values shall be used:
'angular accuracy': A kind of accuracy that specifies the maximum value for the absolute angle between two curve tangents or two surface normals for which the creating system assumes curve tangents or surface normals being identical The angular accuracy value can be used to determine the accuracy range for tangent continuous curve or surface connections.
'curvature accuracy': A kind of accuracy that specifies the value for the term under which a system can assume that the two radii of curvature R1 and R2 are identical. The curvature accuracy value is used to determine the accuracy range for curvature continuous curve or surface connections Terms surrounded by the FORMULA symbols represent the absolute values of these terms.
'distance accuracy': A kind of accuracy that specifies the distance under which two points can be considered as having the same location. The distance accuracy value defined for a Geometric_model is valid for all geometric elements of the Geometric_model.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
a numerical value defining the . The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the radius of a sphere that contains all elements of the model and whose centre is at the origin of the of the External_geometric_model. The model_extent is specified using a length unit. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the object or group of objects that may be varied in each occurrence. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A File_relationship is a relationship between two objects. It specifies that the related is referenced from the relating . A service manual may contain graphics for explanatory reasons. In this case the objects that contain the graphics are referenced as related from the object that contains the body of the service manual with relation_type 'reference'.

the text that provides further information about the File_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the second of the two objects related by the File_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the first of the two objects related by the File_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. The values 'addition', 'decomposition', and 'peer' are only allowed if neither the relating nor the related File are included in a . Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'addition': The application object specifies that the related document provides supplementary or collateral information with regard to the information provided by the relating document; The recommended practices for this part of ISO 10303 may be an addition.
'copy': The application object defines a relationship where the related File is a copy of the relating File;

'decomposition': The application object defines a relationship where the related File is one of potentially more sub documents of the relating File; The decomposition of a document into clauses or into several CAD models is an example for 'decomposition'.

'derivation': The business object defines a relationship where the related File is derived from the relating File; The derivation of a hypertext document from an text document is an example for 'derivation'.

'peer': The application object specifies that the related document provides required information with regard to that provided by the relating document. The peer document is essential for a complete understanding;
'reference': The application object defines a relationship where the related document is referenced from the relating one; The link in a hypertext document may be a reference.
'sequence': The application object defines a logical sequence where the related File comes after the relating File; A sequence of clauses is an example for 'sequence'.
'substitution': The application object defines a relationship where the related File replaces the relating File;
'translation': The application object specifies that the related document is generated through a translation process from the relating document.

ext_description.p: The values 'addition', 'decomposition', and 'peer' are used for the purpose of creating logical structures of documents. These values shall only be used for the relation_type of File_relationship, if the referenced objects do not participate in a . In the latter case, shall be used instead.

ext_description.p:
A General_shape_dependent_property is a type of
that defines a user-defined characteristic of an object. The property_value specified by a General_shape_dependent_property is derived from geometry.
ext_description.note: The General_shape_dependent_property may be used for the purpose of validation of geometric models.
ext_description.example: If a geometry model is exchanged between two partners, the calculation of various properties of the bodies, such as centre of mass, overall surface, or overall volume, is performed by originator and recipient. When comparing these set of values, the existence of deficiencies in the received model can be easily detected.

ext_description.p: the type of characteristic that is specified for an object. The following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'centroid': The property_value identifies the centre point of the mass of a body. The relative position of this point within the body is an invariant datum relative to rotation and translation.; An example, where the use of this General_shape_dependent_property with property_type 'centroid' is used instead of the object , is the following: sometimes the General_shape_dependent_property is calculated by some system at some point of time. But there are cases where the information, e.g., the General_shape_dependent_property of a die, is transferred into a following stage, e.g., in order to perform a feasibility check, where there is only a simplified shape representation that does not allow to calculate the exact General_shape_dependent_property. Yet, in this stage the information about the General_shape_dependent_property is needed in order to check whether the transport of a die with a crane is feasible.
'surface area': The property_value specifies the overall surface of the bodies contained in the referenced shape.;
'volume': The property_value specifies the overall volume of the bodies contained in the referenced shape.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the value that is given for a particular characteristic.
the unit in which the General_shape_dependent_property is expressed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Geometric_model is a

ext_description.p: A Geometrical_relationship is a type of . A Geometrical_relationship is the relationship between two Part_version_view objects specifying two parts that are geometrically related. Therefore, the shape of the related parts may be repre-sented only once and can be reused for the geometrically related situation. In this case the shape of the relating Part_version_view is derived from the shape of the related Part_version_view.

The two Part_version_view objects that are related by this relationship shall belong to different Part_version objects. Other properties except shape are not subject to this relationship and there-fore are not 'inherited' from the related Part_version_view to the relating Part_version_view
ext_description.example: tThe following figure shows an example for a Geometrical_relationship: in this case the left mudguard of a car is symmetrical to the right mudguard. A given plane mirroring transformation specifies the location of the left mudguard regarding the location of the right mudguard.

ext_description.p: An Implicit_transformation_2d is An Implicit_transformation_2d is a transformation that is defined by two instances of axis2_placement_2d in which one instance of axis2_placement_2d is the result of applying the trans-formation function to the other. The transformation function is not explicitly provided, but it is de-rived from the relationship between the instances of axis2_placement_2d. The transformation be-tween the two instances of axis2_placement_2d applies to every element in the objects related by the Implicit_transformation_2d.
