the objects that have been deleted from that object of the described relationship that is identified as relating. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the relationship object that references a modified object and the corresponding original object.
the text that provides further information about the Property_change.

the identifier for the Property_change.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Property_definition is the definition of a particular quality.
ext_description.example: A Property_definition may reflect physics or arbitrary user defined measurements.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Property_definition.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the unit or set of units that are accepted.
ext_description.example: A company may accept a mass specified in kilograms or tons, but not in grams or pounds.
ext_description.p: A representing the Property_definition shall not be expressed with a that is not contained in the allowed_units, if the allowed_units is specified. If specified, the attribute of a representing the shall be contained in the allowed_units, if the allowed_units is specified. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text that provides further information about the Property_definition.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Property_definition.
the or object that defines this kind of Property_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identification of a particular version of a Property_definition. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Property_definition_relationship is a relationship between two objects.
ext_description.example: Property_definition_relationship may be used to indicate that the value of one can be derived from the value of another .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text that provides further information about the Property_definition_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the second of the two objects related by the Property_definition_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the first of the two objects related by the Property_definition_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: specifies the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'decomposition': The Property_definition_relationship defines a relationship where the related is a member of a group of objects that is established by the relating ;
'dependency': The related is dependent upon the relating ;
'hierarchy': The application object defines a hierarchical relationship where the related n is on a lower level than the relating ;
'peer': The related shall not be used without the relating n and vice versa;
'substitution': The Property_definition_relationship defines a relationship where the related replaces the relating ;

'value domain': The Property_definition_relationship defines a relationship where the values assigned to the relating shall be within the limits indicated by the values assigned to the related . The output range of a 4-bit analog to digital converter is restricted to 16 discrete values, while the input voltage is restricted to a continuous range.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Property_relationship is a relationship between two objects.

the text that provides further information about the Property_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the second of the two objects related by the Property_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute is defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: specifies the first of the two objects related by the Property_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute is defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: specifies the meaning of the relationship.
ext_description.example: objects representing 'cycle time', 'feed time', and 'drill time' for a process may be related by a Property_relationship with relation_type 'dependency'.
ext_description.p: Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'decomposition': The Property_relationship specifies a relationship where the related is one of potentially more sub values of the relating ;
'dependency': The Property_relationship defines a deriving relationship where the related is based on the relating ;

'equivalence': The Property_relationship defines a relationship where the related represents the same matter of fact as by the relating The distance of 1 km and 1000 m is the same. 1 km is equivalent to 1000 m, but they have different values and units.
substitution': The Property_relationship defines a relationship where the related replaces the relating .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Property_value is the numerical or textual value of a .

ext_description.p: the words by which the Property_value is known.
ext_description.example: 'l1' or 'vol2' are examples for the name of a Property_value.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Quality_property_definition is a type of
that enables to provide information about the level of quality of products or processes.
ext_description.example: Within a prototype building activity several alternative manufacturing technologies are tested. A Quality_property_definition for the resulting parts, used tools, and the used process operations may document the level of quality reached for the parts.

ext_description.p: A Quantified_part_instance is the identification of the quantified occurrence of an object that is defined either as a Part_version, Part_version_view or as a Product_configuration.
ext_description.example: Radiator liquid or engine oil are examples for Quantified_part_instance objects.
In a Technical_solution for the front left brake a certain screw is used four times.
ext_description.p: A Quantified_part_instance is a type of .

a Numerical_value specifying the quantity of occurrences. If the quantity can not be expressed as a particular value, the concept of Selected_part_instance shall be used instead to represent this instance.
ext_description.note: The quantity may be specified as a count measure, as a mass measure, as a length measure, as an area measure, or as a volume measure.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Rectangular_size is the definition of the planar size of an object.
the resolution of the object if it is a raster picture. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the size of the object in vertical direction. If Rectangular_size is not a the height shall be specified. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the size of the object in horizontal direction. If Rectangular_size is not a the width shall be specified. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Recyclability_property_definition is a type of
representing information concerning the ability to reuse objects or components of objects after their primarily intended usage.
A Replaced_usage_relationship is a type of

ext_description.p:
A Replaced_version_view_relationship is a type of
where the relating Part_version_view is replaced by the related Part_version_view. Each Replaced_version_view_relationship shall be referenced by an Effectivity that defines the start of the validity of the replacement.
ext_description.note: A Replaced_version_view_relationship may be used to build up version sequences of Part_version_view objects.

ext_description.p: A Requirement is a used to uniquely identify a requirement.
ext_description.note: The term "requirement" is used here in the sense that term is used in systems engineering and similar industrial domains.

There may be many versions of a requirement Requirement_version. The requirement entity is simply a placeholder for holding a unique requirement. More associations and assignment could be done through the Requirement or the Requirement_version.
Systems engineering tools and organizations may use differing identification mechanisms. Multiple identifiers may be assigned to a requirement using additional_ids attribute.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the others identifiers that distinguish the requirement for others systems. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Requirement.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Requirement.
the words by which the Requirement is known.
the Organization or the Person_in_organization that has created the Requirement. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the versions of the Requirement.

ext_description.p: A Requirement_assignment is an object used to relate a Requirement to data types representing the items that are affected by the requirement.
ext_description.example: A requirement "the vehicle shall have a maximum power output of at least 150BHP" could be assigned to the data types which are used to represent the vehicle's engine.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the others identifiers that distinguish the Requirement_assignment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Requirement or the Requirement_version which is assigned.
the text that provides further information about the Requirement_assignment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Requirement_assignment.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the item which has the requirement assigned to it.

A Requirement_collection_relationship is a type of
It identifies a collection relationship.

A Requirement_decomposition_relationship is a type of
It identifies a decomposition relationship.

ext_description.p: A Requirement_satisfaction_assertion is a relationship between an item and a requirement, asserting that the item satisfies the identified requirement.
ext_description.example: A data type used to represent a vehicle's engine with a power output of 160BHP could be asserted to satisfy a requirement "the vehicle shall have a maximum power output of at least 150BHP".

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the others identifiers that distinguish the Requirement_satisfaction_assertion. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Organization or the Person_in_organization that has asserted the Requirement satisfaction. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Requirement_satisfaction_assertion.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Requirement_satisfaction_assertion.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the requirement_assignment that is satisfied by the Requirement_satisfaction_assertion. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the items that satisfies the requirement.
the requirement that is satisfied.
A Requirement_sequence_relationship is a type of

ext_description.p: A Requirement_source_association is a relationship between a requirement and the data types representing the source of the requirement.
ext_description.example: The source of the requirement "the vehicle shall have a maximum power output of at least 150BHP" could be a document representing the findings of a market survey of sports car buyers.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the others identifiers that distinguish the Requirement_source_association. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the items which are the source of the requirement.

the text that provides further information about the Requirement_source_association.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Requirement_source_association.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Requirement or Requirement_version which is to be related to its source.

A Requirement_tracing_relationship is a type of
It identifies a tracing relationship.

ext_description.p: A Requirement_version is the identification of a particular version of a requirement.
ext_description.note: This entity is used to record different versions of a requirement. In this case, the word "version" implies "revision" - that is a particular release of a requirement.
ext_description.example: A given requirement might have versions 1.0, 1.1, 1.2 and 2.0.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text that provides further information about the Requirement_version.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Requirement_version.
the Requirement for which the Requirement_version identifies a version.

A Requirement_version_relationship is a type of relationship that is used to relate previous version (related) of a requirement to the version that replaces it (relating). A Requirement_version_relationship is either a General_requirement_version_relationship, a Requirement_sequence_relationship, a Requirement_tracing_relationship, a Requirement_collection_relationship or a Requirement_decomposition_relationship.
the others identifiers that distinguish the Requirement_version_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Requirement_version_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Requirement_version_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the old version of the Requirement.
the new version of the requirement that replace the old Requirement_version.
A Retention_period is the definition of a period of time that product data needs to be maintained due to organizational policy or legal requirements.

the text that provides further information about the Retention_period.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the point in time after which any object the Retention_period is applied to may be deleted or destroyed.
In this context deletion or destruction applies to all subordinate objects that are not referenced by other objects.
the objects whose existence is controlled by the Retention_period.
ext_description.note: The master document is the one for which earliest_end_definition and latest_end_definition are the same.

ext_description.p: the point in time before which any objects that the Retention_period is applied to shall be deleted or destroyed.
In this context deletion or destruction applies to all subordinate objects that are not used by other objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the point in time at which the Retention_period starts.

ext_description.p:
A Same_time_machining_relationship is a type of
relationship between two Part_instance objects that specifies that those two objects shall be manufactured together within the same Process_operation_occurrence.
ext_description.example: The following figure shows an example for this case.

ext_description.p: specifies the geometrical Transformation between the local coordinate system of the related Part_instance with respect to the local coordinate system of the relating Part_instance.
ext_description.note: The transformation is needed to position the related Part_instance with respect to the relating Part_instance for the same time machining process.
ext_description.p: In the case where the placement is realized by a Template_instance the scale factor of that Template_instance shall be omitted or set to 1. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Security_classification is the level of confidentiality that is required in order to protect product data against unauthorized usage.
other identifiers that may be used to distinguish the Security_classification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Security_classification.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Security_classification.
the associated with the object.
A Security_classification_assignment is an association of a with activity or product data.
the assigned to activity or product data.
the objects with which the is associated.

ext_description.p: A Selected_part_instance is the identification of the occurrence of an object that is either defined as a Part_version, Part_version_view or as a Product_configuration and whose quantity depends on certain constraints.
ext_description.example: In a BOM where the exact amount of grease or glue can usually not be specified as a quantity, the specification of this grease or glue are examples for Selected_part_instance objects.

To minimize the concentricity error of a wheel, weights are attached to the rim; this set of weights is a Selected_part_instance. The quantity as well as the position of these weights depends on the concentricity be-haviour of each particular wheel as manufactured and teste d.
ext_description.p: A Selected_part_instance is a type of
the constraint that has to be evaluated for the Selected_part_instance.
ext_description.example: 'as required for balance' and 'as required for lubrication' are examples for a criterion.

ext_description.p: the quantity of the part, tool or raw material foreseen as Selected_part_instance. The quantity shall be of type Value_limit or Value_range.
ext_description.note: If the quantity is to be specified as a minimum and/or a maximum, then Value_limit or Value_range may be used.
ext_description.example: The quantity of engine oil used in a car may be in the range of 3.7 to 3.9 liters. This is expressed using Value_range as the quantity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Serial_configuration is a type of
that applies onwards from a given serial number of the product that is considered within the object referred to as 'is_solution_for'.

ext_description.p: the serial number of that instance of the product that is the last instance for which the Serial_configuration applies. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: If the serial_end_number is not specified, it is not foreseen that the Serial_configuration ceases to be valid; i.e., the Serial_configuration is expected to apply to all serial numbers greater than the serial start number for the product for whose characteristics the Serial_configuration identifies a solution.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the serial number of that instance of the product that is the first instance for which the Serial_configuration applies.
A Serial_effectivity is a type of for which the domain of applicability is defined as a possibly open-ended interval of serial numbers.

the last valid serial number. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the value for this attribute is not specified, the interval of applicability has no upper bound or it is implicitely defined via an with relation_type 'inheritance'.
the first valid serial number.

ext_description.p: A Shape_dependent_property is a characteristic of the shape, or of a portion of the shape of an object. This object is either a , an occurrence of an in the product structure or the physical realization of an .
ext_description.note: A Shape_dependent_property is independent of the representations of the shape.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the text that provides further information about the Shape_dependent_property.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the object that the Shape_dependent_property is associated to.

ext_description.p: specifies the in which the property is applicable.
ext_description.note: The values of geometry related properties are specified relative to a .
ext_description.example: A may be specified in different coordinate spaces for different dimensioning applications.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies information on how the Shape_dependent_property shall be interpreted. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'calculated': The value has been calculated;
'designed': The value represents a value intended by the design;
'estimated': The value has been estimated;
'measured': The value has been measured;
'required': The value represents a requirement.

ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Shape_description_association is a mechanism to associate the definition of a shape or of a portion of a shape with a geometric representation.
ext_description.note: Through Shape_description_association, it is possible to associate objects with geometry defined in an external document; the same is possible through Document_assignment. The difference between the two possibilities is that in the case of Shape_description_association, it is the shape of the object that is assigned whereas Document_assignment may be us

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the Geometric_model or the External_geometric_model that contains the shape information for the is_defining_shape_for.

the text that provides further information about the Shape_description_association.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the object the shape of which is defined by defining_geometry. role: the string that designates the function performed by the defining_geometry.
Where applicable the following values shall be used:
'detailed representation': The geometry in the referenced shape model provides a detailed representation of the object;
'idealized representation': The geometry in the referenced shape model provides a simplified representation of the object, e.g., for analysis purposes.
'simplified representation', 'idealized representation' are examples of role. For analysis purposes an 'idealized representation' that is not fully detailed in every respect may be sufficient and be preferable due to less overhead implied by its usage.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Shape_element is a is a portion of shape that has to be identified explicitly to be associated with other information.
ext_description.note: A Shape_element may be a Coating_layer. NOTE 2 Shape_element objects can be classified using Class.
ext_description.example: In order to identify a portion of one face of a shaft that shall have a surface coating applied to it, Shape_element is used.
An example for classifying Shape_element objects is to identify all parts of an air plane that constitute the outer surface of the plane and are therefore relevant for aerodynamic analyses.
The threaded portion of the shape of a bolt may be represented as a Shape_element, so that other properties, such as surface finish, may be associated with it.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Shape_element. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Shape_element. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the words by which the Shape_element is known. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Part_shape that the Shape_element is part of.
A Shape_element_relationship is a relationship between two Shape_element objects.
the text that provides further information about the Shape_element_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the second of the two Shape_element objects related by the Shape_element_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the first of the two Shape_element objects related by the Shape_element_relationship.
ext_description.note: The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: 'transition' may be used to define the transition between two adjacent Coating_layer objects.

ext_description.p: A Simple_property is a simplified mechanism to associate a property value with an object.
ext_description.note: A Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to a of type or

ext_description.p: specifies the object that is characterized by the .
ext_description.note: The attribute is_assigned_to of Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to . or to .
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the property type that the Simple_property characterizes.
ext_description.note: The attribute property_type of Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to the attribute property_type of which is a subtype of and which is referenced by the attribute of . The itself is referenced by .
ext_description.example: ’noise absorption’, ’power consumption’ or 'colour' are examples for the property_type of a Simple_property.

ext_description.p: specifies the that qualifies the Simple_property by a , a , or a .
ext_description.note: The attribute specified_value of Simple_property corresponds in the more detailed independent property concept to the attribute specified_value of the that itself is referenced by ..

ext_description.p: A Single_part_instance is one particular occurrence of an object that is defined either as a Part_version, Part_version_view or as a Product_configuration.
ext_description.note: A Single_instance may or may not be associated with placement information using an In-stance_placement.
ext_description.example: In a Technical_solution for the 'front left brake', a 'brake disk' is used and its position is specified by a geometric Transformation.
ext_description.p: A Single_part_instance is a type of .

A Specification is a characteristic of a product. A Specification discriminates one product from other members of the same . A Specification refers to a that completes the semantics of the Specification.
ext_description.note: A Specification may be a characteristic of the members of more than one using objects.
A Specification in combination with a may be used to define under which conditions a is used in combination with a .
ext_description.example: 'coupe', 'hatch back', or 'sedan' are examples for specifications belonging to the of type 'car body'. 'radio 1 with CD player' and 'radio 2 without CD player' are examples for specifications belonging to the of type 'radio equipment'. 'disk brake' and 'drum brake' are examples for specifications belonging to the of type 'braking system'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the that completes the semantics of the Specification.

the text that provides further information about the Specification.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the identifier for the Specification.
ext_description.note: The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the words by which the Specification is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: specifies whether this Specification represents a package of Specification objects or not. Such a Specification combines those Specification objects that shall be offered to the market as a set. In the case where package is 'true', there shall be exactly one per Product_class considered, that refers to this Specification by its aqttribute if_condition. The Specification objects that are members of the package, shall be specified in the attribute included_specification of the .
ext_description.note: Commercial packages may be defined by the marketing department.
Usually the members of a package belong to distinct objects.
ext_description.example: A sports package contains sports seats, a special steering wheel, special tyres and wheels. A winter package contains heated front seats, heated windshield washers, heated exterior mirrors, and special tyres.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identification of a particular version of a Specification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Specification_category is a definition of a set of objects serving the same purpose.
ext_description.example: The category 'kind of drive' for the objects 'front wheel drive' and 'rear wheel drive' or the category 'level of equipment' for the objects 'standard', 'comfortable', and 'luxurious' are examples for Specification_category objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification_category. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the text that provides further information about the Specification_category.
ext_description.example: The description 'trim' characterizes a Specification_category for objects that controls the quality and colour of the interior parts including, e.g., inner door panels and upholstery. Other examples are 'kind of drive', 'rear brake type', 'brake power regulator', 'radio equipment', or 'type of car body'.

ext_description.p: the identifier for the Specification_category.
ext_description.example: The scope of uniqueness may be set by the extent of a physical file or database.
ext_description.note: The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.

ext_description.p: specifies whether the objects within the Specification_category are mutually exclusive for the production of one particular product. A value of 'true' indicates that the referenced objects are mutually exclusive for the production of the particular product.
ext_description.example: 'safety equipment' is an example for a non mutually exclusive Specification_category if, e.g., ABS and airbag are objects in this category. 'engine' is an example for a Specification_category with an implicit_exclusive_condition since usually only one engine can be mounted for power supply.
ext_description.note: More complex conditions can be handled using objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Specification_category_hierarchy is a used to build up hierarchical structures of objects.
the lower level of in Specification_category_hierarchy.
the higher level of in Specification_category_hierarchy.
A Specification_expression is a combination of objects formed by Boolean operations.
the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification_expression. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Specification_expression.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the identifier for the Specification_expression.
ext_description.note: The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.
ext_description.p: The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the operands of the Boolean operation that are either objects or other Specification_expression objects. In case the_operation is 'not' there shall be exactly one operand.

ext_description.p: the kind of Boolean operation. The following kinds of operations are permitted:

ul.li: 'and': all of the identified objects shall be used;
'or': a subset or all of the identified objects shall be used;
'oneof': exactly one of the identified objects shall be used;
not': The identified shall not be used. 'not' is an unary operation.

ext_description.p: A Specification_inclusion is a representation of the statement that specifies that the application of a or of a implies the inclusion of an additional or .
ext_description.example: The source of such a completion may be a customer order.
ext_description.note: The Specification_inclusion is intended to complete the set of objects for a in order to enable the manufacturing of the product on the basis of an initial set of objects defined.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers used to distinguish the Specification_inclusion. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Specification_inclusion. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the identifier for the Specification_inclusion.
The scope of uniqueness is usually dependent on the form of implementation.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the or the that serves as the condition for the inclusion.

ext_description.p: the or the objects that are to be included. The included_specification shall not reference a with an operation of type 'or' or 'oneof', except for negating expressions, i.e., as participants in an expression preceded by a 'not' operator. Expressions of operator 'not' shall not be nested within one another.
In the case where more than one is to be included a of type 'and' shall be used.
ext_description.note: In the case where the included_specification is a 'not' expression, the object actually defines an exclusion.

ext_description.p: A Specified_part_instance is a mechanism to identify a certain Part_instance in a multi level assembly structure that reuses partial decompositions.
ext_description.example: A 'chassis' consists among others of the sub assemblies 'front axle' and 'rear axle'. Both axle assemblies consist, among others, of the 'left wheel' and the 'right wheel'. In order to identify the 'left wheel' of the 'rear axle', the Specified_part_instance object references 'left wheel' as re-lated_instance, 'rear axle' as 'upper_usage', and 'chassis' as 'assembly_context'.
ext_description.p: The 'definition' of a Specified_part_instance shall be the same object as the one referenced by the 'related_instance' as 'definition.

A
Specified_part_instance is a type of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an Assembly_definition object in which the instance identified by this mechanism is used.
: the Part_instance that is to be identified. The sub_assembly_relationship shall not be of type Specified_part_instance.
the Part_instance in which the related_instance is used. This Part_instance shall be the immediate upper level instance or another Specified_part_instance.

A String_value is a type of
that represents a sequence of one or more alphanumeric characters.
specifies the string represented by the String_value.
A Styled_model is a
A Supplier_solution is a type of
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Surface_condition is a
A Technical_solution is a type of

ext_description.p: A Template_instance is a replica of a Geometric_model, of a Styled_model, or of an External_model. The location of the replica and any additional geometrical transformation to be applied to the replica, i.e., uniform scaling, rotation or mirroring, are specified by the attributes 'origin' and ’target’.
ext_description.note: In the case where the units of the Cartesian coordinate space of the definition are different from the units to be applied to the Template_instance, unit conversion is required.
In case of length unit conversion this conversion applies in addition to the scale attribute.
ext_description.example: In a technical drawing of a mechanical part with several identical drilling holes, the hole geometry (cir-cle) together with its annotation elements (diameter dimension and centrelines) is defined once. This particular definition is instantiated several times at different locations by corresponding Template_instance objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the additional identifiers used to distinguishes the Template_instance. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Template_instance.

the words by which the Template_instance is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the Axis_placement that defines the origin of the replicated object.
the scaling factor for all Cartesian coordinate directions. The scaling factor shall be positive. If the scaling factor is omitted, it shall be 1.0. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the geometrical transformation applied to the instance. All transformations that can be expressed by an orthonormal 2 × 2 (for 2D) or 3 × 3 (for 3D) matrix can be applied.
ext_description.example: Examples for suitable operations are rotation and mirroring.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Text_specification is a representation that specifies a text.
the others identifiers that distinguish the Text_specification. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Text_specification.

the identifier for the Text_specification.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Time_interval is the specification of a unit of time.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the text that provides further information about the Time_interval.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

defines the end of the Time_interval, either by referring to a bound, or specifying the extend of the Time_interval by a Duration. If the end_definition refers to an Event_reference or Date_time, this particular bound of the resulting interval is excluded from it.

the identifier for the Time_interval.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the words by which the Time_interval is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
defines the beginning of the Time_interval. The bound specified by the start_definition is included in the resulting interval.

ext_description.p: A Time_interval_assignment is aan association of an Time_interval with some product data. The Time_interval_assignment shall neither be used to convey effectivity information, i.e., information concerning valid use of product data, nor to convey retention information, nor duration information.
ext_description.note: Such information is conveyed using Effectivity, Retention_period, and Duration respectively.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the Time_interval that is associated with the product data.

the text that provides further information about the Time_interval_assignment.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the set of objects of product data with which the Time_interval_assignment is assigned.

ext_description.p: specifies the action associated with the Time_interval_assignment. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'installation': The assignment specifies that the object referenced as 'is_applied_to' was mounted in a product during the given interval of time;

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Time_interval_configuration is a type of
that applies for a given period.
the period for which the configuration of the 'configured_element' is valid.
A Time_interval_effectivity is a type of for which the domain of applicability is defined as a .
the that defines the domain of validity.

ext_description.p:
A Tool_part_relationship is a type of
that is a relationship between two Part_version_view objects. It establishes a relationship between a part (related) and a tool (relating) that is used to produce the part.
ext_description.example: This relationship is, by default, valid only in the application contexts that are relevant for both related Part_version_view objects.

ext_description.p: specifies the relative position of the Item representing the part with respect to the local coordinate system of the Item representing the tool. In the case where the placement is realized by a Template_instance, the scale factor of that Template_instance shall be omitted or set to 1. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the technology that is used to manufacture the part using this tool and, possibly, the reasons for the use of a particular technology. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Transformation is a geometric transformation composed of translation and rotation. Scaling is not included.
Each Transformation is a Transformation_3d or a Transformation_2d.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the words by which the Transformation is known.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Transformation_2dis the definition of a geometric transformation in 2D space. A Transformation_2d is a type of Transformation.
A Transformation_2d is a type of .
A Transformation_3d is the definition of a geometric transformation in 3D space.
A Transformation_3d is a type of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Unit is a quantity chosen as a standard in terms of which other quantities may be expressed. The types of units supported by this standard are SI units as well as derived or conversion based units as defined in ISO 10303-41.

ext_description.p: specifies the system in which the Unit is defined.
ext_description.example: 'SI system'

ext_description.p: the words by which the Unit is known.
ext_description.example: 'meter', 'gram', 'gram','litre', or 'volt' are examples for the name.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies a possible prefix for the name.
'milli', 'kilo' are examples for the prefix
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
A Value_limit is a type of
with a qualified numerical value representing either the lower limit or the upper limit of a particular physical characteristic.
ext_description.example: '30.5 max' and '5 min' are examples for a Value_limit.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the value of the limit.

ext_description.p: specifies the kind of the limit. The following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'maximum': The specified limit is an upper limit;
'minimum': The specified limit is a lower limit.

ext_description.p:
A Value_list is a type of
with an ordered collection of objects.
ext_description.example: A may be composed of different property values such as 'mass', 'speed', and 'age' which are altogether necessary in a given context. The Value_list collects all of them in a given order, such that each is identifiable by its index in the list.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the ordered collection of objects that together are provided as a .

A Value_range is a type of
with apair of numerical values representing the range in which the value shall lie.
specifies the minimum acceptable value that is constrained by the Value_range.
specifies the maximum acceptable value that is constrained by the Value_range.

A Value_with_unit is a type of
with either a single numerical measure, or a range of numerical measures with upper, lower, or upper and lower bounds.

specifies the number of decimal digits that are relevant for the use of the Value_with_unit. If present, the numerical measure or range may be specified using more digits than the significant digits but shall not be specified using less digits. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the unit in which the Value_with_unit is expressed.

A Work_order is the authorization for one or more objects to be performed. One or more means that it is controlling the main activity and any sub-activity related to the activity by with of 'decomposition'.
the additional identifiers that distinguish the Work_order. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Work_order. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Work_order.
the set of zero, one or more instances of that define the expected results. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the objects that are controlled by this particular Work_order.

ext_description.p: the order_type specifies the kind of the Work_order. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'design deviation permit': An authorization for a deviation from the approved design data;
'design release': An authorization for the design of a product or of an item or to create a bill of material;
'management resolution': An authorization by a committee, such as the board of directors, to design or change an item;
'manufacturing release': An authorization for the manufacturing process of a product or of an item;
'production deviation permit': An authorization for a deviation from the approved manufacturing process.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identification of a particular version of a Work_order. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Work_request is a solicitation for some work to be done. These requests may not be acted upon depending on the authorization granted to the request or its associated .
the additional identifiers that distinguish the Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the text that provides further information about the Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the identifier for the Work_request.
the personnel that shall be informed about the Work_request and the date when the personnel or organization shall be informed. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the intention of the Work_request. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'change of standard': A request to translate a change to a standard into action;
'cost reduction': A request aimed at reducing the engineering and manufacturing costs of an item;
'customer rejection': A request resulting from a rejection by a customer;
'customer request': A request for an activity that is necessary to solve the request of a customer;
'durability improvement': A request aimed at extending the life time of an item;
'government regulation': A request resulting from legal requirements;
'procurement alignment': A request to adjust the purchasing process of different items;
'production alignment': A request to adjust the manufacturing process of different items;
'production relief': A request aimed at achieving a simpler assembly and production process;
'production requirement': A request for an activity that is necessary from a production point of view;
'quality improvement': A request aimed at increasing the quality of an item;
'security reason': A request for an activity that is necessary from a security point of view;
'standardization': A request to unify variants of an item;
'supplier request': A request for an activity necessary to solve the request of a supplier;
'technical improvement': A request aimed at improving the technical aspects of an item;
'tool improvement': A request aimed at increasing the useful life of a tool.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the person or organization who issued the Work_request and the date when this person or organization issued the Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the objects that are subject to the Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the text that provides a user interpretable designation for the level of completion of the study and resolution of the Work_request.
ext_description.example: The designations 'drafted', 'issued', 'deferred', 'in-hand', 'completed', 'cancelled', and 'rejected' are examples of request status.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identification of a particular version of a Work_request. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A Work_request_relationship is a relationship between two objects.

the text that provides further information about the Work_request_relationship.
The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the second of the two objects related by the Work_request_relationship. The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.
the first of the two objects related by the Work_request_relationship.The semantics of this attribute are defined by the attribute relation_type.

ext_description.p: the meaning of the relationship. Where applicable the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'dependency': The related is dependent on the relating .

ext_description.note: This means that the related has the same direction as the relating ;
